name: 資訊社會學研究
comment: 上課教室：圖資所研討室A
description:
Upon completion of this course, students in this graduate seminar will be able to:
 Describe the origin, history, nature of the field of social informatics
 Apply the theoretical knowledge of social informatics to real world research practice
 Communicate with the larger research and practice community using the perspectives and methods of social informatics
goals: Apply the theoretical knowledge of social informatics to real world research practice
syllabus:
Introduction to the Course  
Overview of Social Informatics  
Origin, History, and Nature of Social Informatics  
Social Informatics in Practice  
Research Methods for Social Informatics (I): Key Ideas  
Research Methods for Social Informatics (II): Scholarly Communication  
SI Theories (I): Social Construction of Technology  
SI Theories (II): Actor Network Theory  
SI Theories (III): Socio-Technical Interaction Networks  
SI Theories (IV): Social Network Theory  
SI Theories (V): Structuration Theory  
SI Theories (VI): Critical Social Theory  
Information Society
